Reviews.Content: Simple and convenient We stayed 4 nights at Kadoya during our visit to Tokyo. The hotel was rather basic and small, but it was clean and you can't go wrong for the price and location (a short walk from Shinjuku railway station). Highly recommended for budget travellers in Tokyo.
Reviews.Author: wsantoso

Reviews.Content: Great value for the money We stayed in the upgraded twin room and found it to be an excellent value. Not only was it more like the traditional two double bed hotel rooms I'm used to at home, but there was an air purifier and a fabulous reclining massage chair in it as well. My daughter has allergies so I was worried about her asthma acting up as we were staying in a smoking room, but the air purifier made the place odour free. There is no view due to the surrounding skyscrapers, but the 45th floor of the government buildings is only two blocks away and it's free!
Reviews.Author: ArankaC

Reviews.Content: Great location. Small but perfect rooms Stayed the Kodoya Hotel, Shinjuku area of Tokyo for three nights in April 2008. The hotel is just 5 mins' walk from Shinjuku station and an easy 10 mins walk from a stack of bars and restaurants. The bedroom was small but clean and perfect with a great view of the street. On the ground floor, there was an adquate cafe serving breakfast. A big plus is a lively basement restaurant serving grilled Japanese food. No WiFi in the hotel which was a bit of a shame, but free internet for your lap top. Would stay again. Recommended.
Reviews.Author: Shinkansen1966

Reviews.Content: Grim hotel I've just read the reviews of this hotel and can't believe its the same place!The hotel is conveniently located but is smelly, dirty and is in dire need of a revamp.The hotel stinks of cigarette smoke and the bathroom left alot to be desired. The sink was clogged with hair and there was mould growing on the bathroom wall.What made the experience worse was that the air conditioning pumped out hot air! When we called down to reception we were told there was no need for air conditioning despite the fact the rooms were extremely hot.. This meant we had to sleep with the window open which was noisy at all hours.And don't bother with the breakfast in the next door cafe either! Not one day did the staff get our order right and the food left alot to be desired.
Reviews.Author: hollysaysboo

Reviews.Content: You could not go wrong with Kadoya       Bathroom
Reviews.Author: Atom

Reviews.Content: Great little hotel Stayed here half dozen times, most recently Dec 07. Single room is large for a business hotel. Location is great, better than the neighbouring Keio Plaza and Hyatt Regency costing 2x to 3x as much.You can book at other than hotel's own site but it will be the same rates, though English and Japanese booking sites do have different booking requirements and special plans. If you don't read Japanese, you can't take advantage of those. They have BBC World but dubbed in Japanese(at source) except for a few hours during the day and at night. Pillows are usually the Tempur brand. This time front desk refused to connect an incoming overseas call at 3am local time and I was a bit ticked off.
Reviews.Author: bibimbob

Reviews.Content: Small rooms, but big location! Excellent location in West Shinkjuku makes this a great base for exploring Tokyo. It's a 5 minute walk from the west exit of Shinkuju station so not far too drag bags to. Surrounded by bars, restaurants and shops, along with an enormous branch of Big Echo if you fancy some late night karaoke - you know you want to! If you book BB breakfast is taken in the adjacent cafe - absolutely fine, western or Japanese options. If you don't fancy this, there a couple of excellentcoffee shops over the road. And this being Japan, there is a vending machine slap bang outside the hotel and a convinience store next door.Rooms are small but then you're not going all the way to Japan to sit in a hotel room. Would recommend.
Reviews.Author: This-Space-To-Rent

Reviews.Content: Good Value and Location I stayed here for four nights. Excellent location. You can take the train from Narita straight to the Shinjuku station a couple of blocks away. Good places to eat within a block or two. Good subway access. You can walk to the very exciting East Shinjuku area for late night life. I did not pre-pay for the breakfast but did try it one day. I thought you got better value eating elsewhere although the service was good.
Reviews.Author: tikiliki

Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, suffice for a short stay Nice location in Shinjuku, it made getting around Tokyo easy as the train station was only a 5 minute walk away.Although the hotel had the smell of smoke in some areas, it is a nice little cosy hotel. Rooms are relatively clean, but mind you the rooms are also very small as with most Japanese business hotels.Service was good, and it was handy having a free internet enabled computer downstairs.
Reviews.Author: danny.jak

Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Just got back after a 14 day stay at KADOYA.What a great little hotel!Super clean,great staff and very close to everything.Rooms are on the small side but very well laid out  the view isn't half bad.Highly recommended!
Reviews.Author: postoumios

Reviews.Content: Great Value for Money We stayed at the Kadoya in February 2007 on the recommendation of a friend and were very pleased. The location is great - a 3 minute walk to Shinjuku Station (which is handy for the airport bus and lots of metro and mainline rail services), and a 10 minute walk to the big Shinjuku department stores (including our absolute favourite - Isetan!). There are lots of shops and restaurants over the road but the hotel is set on a quieter block. We found the double room that we started out in to be a little cramped and the friendly and obliging staff moved us to a twin room a couple of doors down that cost just over 1000 yen more but was quite a bit bigger. It's definitely worth paying extra for a larger room. Both rooms were quiet and spotlessly clean. We thought the Kadoya was great value for money and would stay there again.
Reviews.Author: GC44

Reviews.Content: comfy and homely This hotel is very close to Shinjuku station and in a very busy area. However there was no noise at night at all. The rooms were small and but very clean and comfortable with every product you can wish for in the bathroom.It was the only hotel in Japan that we stayed at that had an english speaking TV channel -BBC World- so we could catch up on events in the rest of the world.The attached cafe is where you go to have breakfast, which is fine, but they do serve wonderful cakes throughout the day and exceelent coffee.The staff were friendly and a few could speak English, one in particular who was on reception on our second stay was excellent. They even sold umbrellas in the reception which we needed as it poured most of the time we were in Tokyo.I could definitley recommend the Kadoya if you are looking for a good value hotel which is comfortable and clean.
Reviews.Author: najtaek

Reviews.Content: Brilliant location in a V. good hotel The hotel was comfortable and clean, and there was free access to a computer with internet connection in the lobby. The staff were friendly and they spoke enough english to get by. Breakfast is served in the adjoining cafe - with a choice of 4 different menus - they made no problem about changing the coffee/tea option for a cup of hot chocolate every morning. I thought the price was really reasonable - we paid about 75 euros a night for the 2 of us in a double room (breakfast not included - that was about 4 euros with the 100 yen discount coupon they gave us).the best thing has to be the location - shinjuku is really lively every day of the week - there are loads of very affordable restaurants and shops, there's a starbucks really close to the hotel, game halls (look out especially for the drum game - not the modern looking one, but the one with the 2 round drums - one face is red the other blue - brilliant fun), we also stumbled on a baseball batters ball hitting area in the east side of shinjuku. Walking straight behind the hotel, away from the station, are the metropolitan south and north towers, which give you a good view of tokyo - free and open until 23pm. I will definately stay here again if I return to Tokyo.
Reviews.Author: Nurse Gertrude

Reviews.Content: Great Location Great price. Great location.I paid JPY13000 per night  get a great twin room in the center of Shinjuku. Highly recommand
Reviews.Author: UOPHenry

Reviews.Content: Convenient lodging in Shinjuku We decided for this hotel after reading several comments here. We were not disappointed. The hotel is well located, between the skyscraper district and the entertainment area near Shinjuku JR Station. The rooms are quite small but our expectations were low in that aspect after reading comments on other Tokyo hotels. There are plenty of places to eat and shop nearby, several department stores and banks. Depending on the weather you can walk to Shinjuku station underground. The staff at the lobby was very helpful and there is a pc that you can use for free to check the Internet. The breakfast (not included) was not a great deal but you can find good places very close. There is a laundry inside the hotel. Check out time is 11:00 am, which is very convenient for flights to the US. Our only complain is that one of the rooms had a cigarette stench the first day but it disappeared the next day. Although the area is quiet noisy at nights, at the room you hear nothing.
Reviews.Author: Andariego

Reviews.Content: Very pleased!       My single room at the Kadoya
Reviews.Author: misslassie

Reviews.Content: Good value for the location A small, basic hotel in quiet West Shinjuku, next to Keio Plaza Hotel and City Hall. It's the closest hotel in west Shinjuku to the train sation, for easy airport bus/train access, among other things. There is only a tiny lobby but a western and a Japanese restaurant on the premises. It's quiet and yet you only have to cross the street to access the post office for ATM, numerous restaurants, huge electronics stores, etc. The single rooms are large compared to other business hotels. Free broadband hookup. Great for independent travellers.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Tr猫s bien situ茅 et bon rapport qualit茅-prix   showReview(21367171, 'full');
Reviews.Author: mayouli
